svg.text:
This model illustrates the implementation of - a finite state machine to compute the room temperature set point, - a proportional controller, and - a room model.
Input to the room model is the control signal u_k. Output of the room model is the new room temperature T_{k+1}.
All models are implemented using Ptolemy II actors.

This model computes the setpoint temperature for night time and day time.
The first block computes a flag indicating day or night time. The second block is a finite state machine that computes the room set point temperature, depending on the value of the time of day flag. Instead of using a finite state machine, this controller could have been implemented using an "if-then" construct, but we have choosen to use the finite state machine implementation for illustration.

Finite state machine that selects two different algorithms, one for the night and one for the day, to compute the room temperature set point.
Depending on the state, only one algorithm is computed at each time step.
To see the algorithm, right-click on the state and select "Look Inside"

property.name: text
property.value: Algorithm for computing the cooling room set point temperature during daytime.

property.name: text
property.value: Algorithm for computing the cooling room set point temperature during nighttime.
